title: Embarrassingly Simple Unsupervised Aspect Extraction
authors:
Tulkens, St{\'e}phan  and
van Cranenburgh, Andreas
venue: Proceedings of the 58th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
abstract: We present a simple but effective method for aspect identification in sentiment analysis. Our unsupervised method only requires word embeddings and a POS tagger, and is therefore straightforward to apply to new domains and languages. We introduce Contrastive Attention (CAt), a novel single-head attention mechanism based on an RBF kernel, which gives a considerable boost in performance and makes the model interpretable. Previous work relied on syntactic features and complex neural models. We show that given the simplicity of current benchmark datasets for aspect extraction, such complex models are not needed. The code to reproduce the experiments reported in this paper is available athttps://github.com/clips/cat.
